clinical_study.brief_title: A Team-Based Care for Hypertension Management (TBC-HTA)
clinical_study.official_title: A Team-Based Care for Hypertension Management (TBC-HTA): A Randomized Controlled Study

collaborator.agency: University of Applied Sciences of Western Switzerland

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether a team-based care (TBC) intervention, combining physician, nurse and pharmacist care improves BP control compared to usual care at 6 months among outpatients with uncontrolled hypertension.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in daytime ABPM at 6-month between TBC and usual care patients
primary_outcome.description: Difference in daytime ABPM at 6-month between TBC and usual care patients

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in the proportion of patients with controlled blood pressure (daytime ABPM <135/85 mmHg) at 6-month between TBC and usual care patients
primary_outcome.description: Difference in the proportion of patients with controlled blood pressure (daytime ABPM <135/85 mmHg) at 6-month between TBC and usual care patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients and healthcare professionals' acceptance and satisfaction with the TBC-intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Patients and healthcare professionals' acceptance and satisfaction with the TBC-intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the proportion of TBC and usual care patients with controlled blood pressure (daytime ABPM <135/85 mmHg) at 12-month (6 months after intervention stopped)
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in the proportion of TBC and usual care patients with controlled blood pressure (daytime ABPM <135/85 mmHg) at 12-month (6 months after intervention stopped)
